GENERAL NOTES <!-- text, from page 0 (l=0.097,t=0.018,r=0.145,b=0.030), with ID 9f4a2a88-66ff-45e1-abcb-d65b3cc091e7 -->

DOOR FRAME ELEVATIONS <!-- marginalia, from page 0 (l=0.238,t=0.018,r=0.310,b=0.030), with ID b8353ee3-8fb4-4f62-9072-7e3337d58426 -->

DOOR PANEL TYPE ELEVATIONS <!-- marginalia, from page 0 (l=0.816,t=0.017,r=0.898,b=0.031), with ID 9b045e10-bae5-409a-b6d0-2578082c953d -->

- PROVIDE SCAFFOLD, DOOR SWEEPS, AND SHOE THRESHOLD AT ALL EXTERIOR DOORS.
- HARDWARE SHALL COMPLY WITH ALL CODES FOR OPERATION AND HANDICAP ACCESSIBILITY AS REQUIRED.
- VERIFY ALL QUANTITIES, HAND OPERATION, COMPATIBILITY OF COMPONENTS AND COMPLETENESS OF HARDWARE. CONTACT ARCHITECT FOR CLARIFICATION.
- IN THE CASE OF DISCREPANCIES OR ERRORS, CONTACT ARCHITECT BEFORE ORDERING.
- AUTOMATIC FIRE/RATED SW'S MAY BE APPROVED UPON REQUESTS. CONTACT ARCHITECT FOR APPROVAL.
- PROVIDE SAMPLES OF HARDWARE COMPONENTS TO ARCHITECT FOR APPROVAL.
- PROVIDE 20 MIN. FIRE RATED/PAINT TREATED WOOD BLOCKING BEHIND ALL H.M. FRAMES, STUD SOIL WALLS WHERE MOUNTED TO STUDS (MINIMUM). PROVIDE AT ALL DOOR FRAMES AND HOSPITAL OPENINGS, PROVIDE 3" MIN. SOLID BLOCKING FOR DOOR CLOSER AND DOOR LOCK.
- PROVIDE COORDINATION FOR DOOR HARDWARE BY OTHERS - G.C. SHALL COORDINATE.
- PROVIDE DOOR STOPS AS REQUIRED.
- COORDINATE LOCATIONS OF DOORS, CONFERENCE BETWEEN OWNER, OWNER'S CONSULTANT, AND ARCHITECT. LOCATIONS OF ELECTRICAL SIGNAL BE COORDINATED WITH DOOR HARDWARE.
- SEE SHEET A8.01 FOR GUARD INFORMATION. <!-- text, from page 0 (l=0.026,t=0.034,r=0.139,b=0.173), with ID 914260f0-72eb-4a8d-8db5-01c6dd1548cc -->

Summary : This architectural detail drawing illustrates the construction and installation of a stone threshold (TR7) at a door opening, showing the relationship between the door, floor finishes, and the stone threshold.

technical drawing:
# Threshold Details :
  • Title: "THRESHOLD DETAILS"
  • Detail reference: "TR7 - STONE THRESHOLD"
  • Scale: 3" = 1'-0"
  • Drawing shows a cross-sectional view at a door opening.

# Components & Labels :
  • Door frame, with annotation: "DOOR FRAME SCHEDULED, CENTER TRANSITION UNDER DOOR"
  • Floor finish on both sides of the threshold, labeled "FLOOR FINISH, AS SCHEDULED"
  • 1/2" thick stone threshold, labeled "1/2" THICK STONE THRESHOLD SET IN GROUTED ADHESIVE"
  • The stone threshold is set in adhesive and spans the width of the frame.
  • Dashed lines indicate the extent of the floor finish and the threshold.
  • Dimension line labeled "WIDTH OF FRAME" showing the threshold width matches the door frame.

# Annotations & Dimensions :
  • All key elements are labeled with leader lines.
  • The drawing is not to full scale but provides a scale reference for construction.
  • The threshold thickness is specified as 1/2".
  • The threshold is set in "GROUTED ADHESIVE".

# Analysis :
  • The detail ensures the stone threshold is centered under the door and matches the width of the frame.
  • Both adjacent floor finishes abut the threshold, providing a clean transition.
  • The use of grouted adhesive secures the stone threshold in place.
  • The drawing provides clear guidance for construction and installation of the threshold in architectural projects. <!-- figure, from page 0 (l=0.025,t=0.188,r=0.142,b=0.305), with ID 0ce56862-566f-4631-a5d2-903377feb7c3 -->

Summary : This is a construction detail section illustrating the interface between two porcelain tile floor areas, showing the use of a Schluter flooring transition strip and self-leveling compound.

section detail:
Components & Labels :
  • Porcelain tile is shown on both sides of the joint.
  • A Schluter flooring transition strip (color: satin anodized) is placed at the joint between the tiles.
  • Self-leveling compound is indicated beneath the tiles at the joint.

Spatial Relationships :
  • The transition strip is centered between the two porcelain tile sections.
  • The self-leveling compound is located directly below the transition strip and tiles, providing a level substrate.

Analysis :
  • The detail demonstrates a method for creating a smooth, durable transition between two tiled floor areas using a metal transition strip and self-leveling compound for substrate preparation. <!-- figure, from page 0 (l=0.025,t=0.299,r=0.138,b=0.355), with ID 90983e9e-9aa9-48ff-92b8-de946de2bf28 -->

6  TR6 - PORCELAIN TILE
    SCALE: 3" = 1'-0" <!-- text, from page 0 (l=0.026,t=0.355,r=0.137,b=0.385), with ID b51782ad-df31-406d-a365-9af657dcb1a5 -->

Summary : This is a construction detail section illustrating the interface between a door, floor tile, and carpet at a scheduled center transition under a door, including material callouts and finish notes.

section detail:
# Door and Floor Transition :
  • Door is shown in elevation, centered above a transition strip.
  • Floor tile is depicted on one side of the transition.
  • Carpet is depicted on the opposite side of the transition.
  • The transition occurs directly under the door.

# Material Callouts :
  • "DOOR WHERE SCHEDULED, CENTER TRANSITION UNDER DOOR"
  • "FLOOR TILE" on one side of the transition.
  • "SCHLUTER SCHIENE, OR SIMILAR, CLEAR ANODIZED ALUMINUM FINISH" at the transition strip.
  • "CARPET" on the opposite side of the transition.
  • "EXISTING SLAB w/ ARDEX OR SIMILAR" as the substrate below both finishes.

# Spatial Relationships :
  • The transition strip is aligned directly under the door leaf.
  • Floor tile and carpet meet at the transition strip, each on one side of the door.
  • All elements are shown in section (cut-through) view.

# Analysis :
  • The detail clarifies how to align and finish the transition between tile and carpet at a doorway, specifying the use of a metal transition strip for a clean, durable edge. The section ensures the transition is centered under the door for a neat appearance and functional separation of flooring types. <!-- figure, from page 0 (l=0.026,t=0.391,r=0.136,b=0.453), with ID 21c24717-a648-4c72-ad4d-c2ab714df7fd -->

SCALE: 3" = 1'-0" <!-- text, from page 0 (l=0.026,t=0.467,r=0.136,b=0.497), with ID bb6a36b5-291f-4110-8e13-ff0cd59a8b2d -->

Summary : This is a technical section detail drawing showing the installation of an ADA-compliant flush threshold at a door, with references to floor tile, aluminum threshold, and matching door frame.

section detail:
Threshold & Floor Interface :
  • Floor tile labeled as "FLR TILE, EA-SIZE" on both sides of the threshold.
  • ADA-compliant flush threshold, specified as mill aluminum finish unless noted otherwise.
  • Threshold is centered and aligned with the door frame.
  • Note to "MATCH DOOR FRAME LWD" (likely referring to width).

Annotations & Materials :
  • Threshold material: mill aluminum finish.
  • No other materials or finishes specified unless otherwise noted.

Spatial Relationships :
  • The threshold sits flush with the floor tile on both sides.
  • The section is symmetrical about the threshold centerline.

Analysis :
  • The detail ensures accessibility compliance (ADA) by specifying a flush threshold.
  • The use of mill aluminum provides durability and a standard finish.
  • The drawing emphasizes alignment and matching with the door frame for a seamless transition. <!-- figure, from page 0 (l=0.028,t=0.518,r=0.138,b=0.574), with ID f5f5b9f5-404d-41dc-b45b-71516054b70e -->

4  TR4 - FLUSH ADA THRESHOLD  
SCALE: 3" = 1'-0" <!-- text, from page 0 (l=0.027,t=0.577,r=0.134,b=0.605), with ID c73fd9e3-d3f8-4225-ae53-09d22b3638e1 -->

Summary : This architectural section detail illustrates the transition between a tile floor and an exposed concrete slab or VCT (vinyl composition tile) at a door threshold, specifying the use of a Schluter pencil or similar aluminum trim.

section detail:
# Door Threshold Transition :
  • Shows a door installed above a floor transition.
  • Left side: floor tile.
  • Right side: exposed concrete slab or VCT, as indicated by the finish schedule.

# Components & Materials :
  • Door where scheduled; center transition under door.
  • Schluter pencil or similar, clear anodized aluminum finish, used as a trim at the edge of the tile.
  • Floor tile on one side of the threshold.
  • Exposed concrete slab or VCT on the other side.
  • Transition occurs directly under the door.

# Annotations & Labels :
  • "DOOR WHERE SCHEDULED; CENTER TRANSITION UNDER DOOR"
  • "SCHLUTER PENCIL OR SIMILAR, CLEAR ANODIZED ALUMINUM FINISH"
  • "FLOOR TILE"
  • "EXPOSED CONCRETE SLAB or VCT WHERE INDICATED ON FINISH SCHEDULE"

# Spatial Relationships :
  • The tile and concrete/VCT meet directly beneath the door.
  • The Schluter trim provides a clean edge between the two floor finishes.

# Analysis :
  • The detail ensures a neat, durable transition between different flooring materials at a doorway, with the transition concealed under the door for visual continuity and protection of tile edges. <!-- figure, from page 0 (l=0.027,t=0.617,r=0.134,b=0.693), with ID bece2fab-c3ee-4b8a-be09-f7a127cc8067 -->

3  TR3 - TILE/CONC  
SCALE: 1" = 1'-0" <!-- text, from page 0 (l=0.026,t=0.699,r=0.134,b=0.728), with ID 64fe0f22-33d5-4e55-999d-97a36d494355 -->

Summary : This is a technical section detail drawing showing the installation of an ADA-compliant bumper threshold at a door frame, set between two exposed concrete slabs, with sealant applied on the door approach side.

technical section detail:
Threshold & Door Frame : 
  • ADA-compliant bumper threshold, finish: aluminum.
  • Threshold is centered under the width of the door frame.
  • Sealant is applied on the door approach (DA) side of the threshold.

Floor Slabs : 
  • Exposed concrete slab on both sides of the threshold, labeled "DA. SIDE".

Annotations & Labels : 
  • "ADA-COMPLIANT BUMPER THRESHOLD, FINISH ALUMINUM FINISH" is called out with a leader line.
  • "SEALANT, DA. SIDE" is called out with a leader line.
  • "EXPOSED CONCRETE SLAB, DA. SIDE" is labeled on both sides of the threshold.
  • "WIDTH DOOR FRAME" is labeled below the threshold.

Spatial Relationships : 
  • The threshold sits flush between two concrete slabs.
  • The sealant is only on the approach (DA) side, not both sides.

Analysis : 
  • The drawing provides a clear construction detail for accessible threshold installation, emphasizing ADA compliance, proper placement of sealant, and the relationship between the threshold, door frame, and adjacent concrete slabs. <!-- figure, from page 0 (l=0.027,t=0.742,r=0.134,b=0.838), with ID 4f7f966f-a774-4ff1-a73e-7d8a35ad0275 -->

Summary : This architectural detail section illustrates the interface between a continuous floor tile system and an exterior concrete slab or paving, focusing on the threshold condition at a door.

section detail:
# Title & Scale :
  • Detail titles: "TR2 - CONC/CONC" and "TR1 - TITLE/EXTERIOR".
  • Both details are drawn at a scale of 3" = 1'-0".

# Components & Labels :
  • "MILLED ALUM ADA-COMPLIANT JON PROFILE THRESHOLD SET IN CONTINUOUS SEALANT, EXTERIOR & INTERIOR. PROVIDE EXTENSION AS INDICATED ON FINISH PLAN."
  • "EXPOSED CONC SLAB OR BIT PAVING" (exterior side).
  • "CONT. SCHLUTER" (at tile edge).
  • "FLOOR TILE" (interior side).
  • "1/8" x 1/8" GROUT JOINT" (between tiles).
  • "METAL STRIPPING CONT. UNDER THRESHOLD; COLOR: ANODIZED CHR."
  • "CONT. WATERPROOFING OVER CONC MASS" (beneath tile).

# Spatial Relationships :
  • The section is cut perpendicular to the threshold, showing the transition from interior tile to exterior concrete.
  • The threshold sits above the substrate, bridging the two finishes.
  • Waterproofing and metal stripping are located beneath the threshold and tile.

# Analysis :
  • The detail ensures a flush, ADA-compliant transition between interior and exterior surfaces, with attention to waterproofing and durability at the threshold. The use of continuous sealant and metal stripping under the threshold addresses water infiltration and finish longevity. <!-- figure, from page 0 (l=0.027,t=0.832,r=0.140,b=0.978), with ID a4b82be4-2a4e-4b95-a3f6-f61537dc342f -->

Summary : This figure shows two architectural door elevation details labeled (A) and (B), each with dimensioned clearances and references to a door schedule.

architectural elevation detail:
# Elevation Views :
   • Two labeled views: (A) and (B).
   • Both show double-door configurations with sidelights or panels.
   • Each elevation is annotated with "SEE DOOR SCHEDULE" on the left vertical side.

# Dimensions & Annotations :
   • (A): 
     – Left clearance: 2" (50 mm).
     – Door width: 3' - 1 1/2" (950 mm).
     – Center mullion: 2" (50 mm).
     – Right door width: 3' - 1 1/2" (950 mm).
     – Right clearance: 2" (50 mm).
     – All dimensions are called out above the doors.
     – "SEE DOOR SCHEDULE" note above both doors.
   • (B): 
     – Left clearance: 1 1/2" (38 mm).
     – Door width: 3' - 1 1/2" (950 mm).
     – Center mullion: 2" (50 mm).
     – Right door width: 3' - 1 1/2" (950 mm).
     – Right clearance: 1 1/2" (38 mm).
     – "SEE DOOR SCHEDULE" note above both doors.

# Design Encodings :
   • Thin black lines for door and frame outlines.
   • Dashed lines for dimension lines.
   • Dimensions in both imperial (inches, feet) and metric (mm).
   • Elevation labels (A) and (B) below each drawing.

# Analysis :
   • Both elevations provide detailed door and frame dimensions for construction or specification.
   • The main difference is the side clearance: (A) uses 2" (50 mm) while (B) uses 1 1/2" (38 mm).
   • Both reference a separate door schedule for further information. <!-- figure, from page 0 (l=0.189,t=0.180,r=0.307,b=0.282), with ID 30619de8-9f51-4109-9bad-ef4dcf40bdf6 -->

Summary : This architectural elevation drawing shows the front view of a rapid rolling, low headroom door, with references to a door schedule for specific dimensions.

elevation drawing:
# Door Type and Label :
  • Door labeled as "RRL-4".
  • Described as "RAPID ROLLING, LOW HEADROOM".

# Dimension References :
  • Both width and height are annotated with "SEE DOOR SCHEDULE" instead of explicit measurements.
  • Dimension lines with arrows indicate the extents for width and height.

# Door Features :
  • Depicts a roll-up style door with horizontal slats.
  • Door is framed by two vertical jambs and a horizontal head section.
  • No additional architectural or mechanical details are shown.

# Text Annotations :
  • "SEE DOOR SCHEDULE" appears at the top and left side, indicating that actual dimensions are specified elsewhere.
  • Door type and description are centered below the drawing.

# Analysis :
  • The drawing provides a generic elevation for a rapid rolling door, intended to be used in conjunction with a separate door schedule for project-specific sizing. No unique or project-specific features are visible in this view. <!-- figure, from page 0 (l=0.375,t=0.178,r=0.473,b=0.296), with ID 1732bae7-4d2c-4995-9964-7173ebcf96d2 -->

Summary : This architectural elevation drawing shows a sectional view of an overhead coiling door, with references to a door schedule for dimensions and specifications.

architectural elevation:
# Door Elevation :
  • Depicts a single overhead coiling door in closed position.
  • The door is represented with horizontal lines indicating the coiled slats.
  • The door is framed by a rectangular outline, with a header above.

# Annotations & References :
  • "SEE DOOR SCHEDULE" is noted at the top and left, indicating that door dimensions and details are specified elsewhere.
  • "OVERHEAD COILING" is labeled below the door, identifying the door type.

# Dimensions & Layout :
  • No explicit numeric dimensions are shown in this crop; all sizing is referenced to the door schedule.
  • The drawing is a straight-on elevation (front view), with no perspective or sectional cut lines visible.

# Analysis :
  • The figure is a standard architectural elevation used to indicate the location and type of an overhead coiling door, with all critical dimensions and specifications deferred to a separate door schedule. The drawing is schematic and not to scale. <!-- figure, from page 0 (l=0.490,t=0.174,r=0.561,b=0.292), with ID 70c9b381-4e89-4d81-8d4d-f5d39986130e -->

Summary : This architectural drawing shows the elevation view of an overhead sectional door, with references to a door schedule for dimensions.

elevation drawing:
Title & Labels :
  • Title at bottom: "OVERHEAD SECTIONAL".
  • Door identifier: "OHD".
  • Top and left callouts: "SEE DOOR SCHEDULE" (indicating dimensions are specified elsewhere).

Drawing Content :
  • Depicts a rectangular overhead sectional door with four horizontal panels.
  • Dashed line near the top panel, possibly indicating a window or break line.
  • No hardware, handles, or other features shown.

Annotations & Dimensions :
  • No explicit numeric dimensions on this sheet; all dimensions referenced to a separate door schedule.
  • Arrowheads at all four corners, indicating extents of the door.

Analysis :
  • The drawing provides a generic elevation for an overhead sectional door, with all sizing and specific details deferred to a door schedule. The focus is on the door's panel layout and its position within a wall opening. <!-- figure, from page 0 (l=0.568,t=0.175,r=0.698,b=0.291), with ID 39c04edf-2bce-45f9-be03-cc46909b9494 -->

Summary : This architectural diagram shows two types of door elevations with louver configurations, labeled "DOUBLE LOUVER" and "LOUVER," including references to door schedules and typical door sizes.

architectural elevation diagram:
# Door Types :
  • Left: Double door with two louver panels at the bottom, labeled "DOUBLE LOUVER" and "L/L".
  • Right: Single door with one louver panel at the bottom, labeled "LOUVER" and "L".

# Annotations & Labels :
  • Both doors have dashed diagonal lines indicating door swing.
  • "SEE DOOR SCHEDULE" is noted above each door.
  • "TYPICAL DOOR SIZE" is marked vertically beside each door.

# Louver Details :
  • Double door: Each leaf contains a rectangular louver panel at the lower section.
  • Single door: Contains a single rectangular louver panel at the lower section.

# Dimensions & References :
  • No explicit numeric dimensions are shown.
  • The diagram references a separate door schedule for further details.

Analysis :
  • The diagram visually distinguishes between single and double louvered door options, clarifying their appearance and labeling for architectural documentation. The use of louvers suggests ventilation requirements for these doors. <!-- figure, from page 0 (l=0.730,t=0.191,r=0.812,b=0.292), with ID 7cb41464-7761-43de-9ec9-9d549368d8a5 -->

Summary : This architectural drawing shows two types of full glass doors, one double and one single, with their respective labels, dimensions, and schedule references.

architectural elevation drawing:
# Door Types :
  • Left: Double full glass doors, labeled "F08 / F08A".
  • Right: Single full glass panel door, labeled "F08".
  • Both doors have grid patterns on the glass panels.

# Labels & Annotations :
  • "SEE DOOR SCHEDULE" is noted above and to the right of each door, indicating reference to a separate door schedule for details.
  • "DOUBLE FULL GLASS, EQUAL LITES" is written below the double door.
  • "FULL GLASS PANEL, EQUAL LITES" is written below the single door.
  • "EQUAL" is noted under both doors, referring to equal-sized glass lites/panels.

# Dimensions & Layout :
  • Both doors are shown in elevation view with dimension lines indicating width and height, but no specific numeric values are provided in this crop.
  • The double door is wider than the single door.
  • Both doors have rectangular outlines with internal grid lines representing glass divisions.

# Symbols :
  • A triangle symbol with the number "1" appears at the bottom left, likely a reference marker for the drawing set.

# Analysis :
  • The figure provides a clear visual comparison between a double and a single full glass door, both with equal-sized glass lites, and directs the viewer to consult the door schedule for further specifications. The drawing is intended for architectural documentation and coordination. <!-- figure, from page 0 (l=0.815,t=0.187,r=0.904,b=0.295), with ID 3541b0cd-a082-4bd7-bd7c-5f463b89afb0 -->

chunks.text: GENERAL NOTES
DOOR FRAME ELEVATIONS
DOOR PANEL TYPE ELEVATIONS

- PROVIDE SCAFFOLD, DOOR SWEEPS, AND SHOE THRESHOLD AT ALL EXTERIOR DOORS.
- HARDWARE SHALL COMPLY WITH ALL CODES FOR OPERATION AND HANDICAP ACCESSIBILITY AS REQUIRED.
- VERIFY ALL QUANTITIES, HAND OPERATION, COMPATIBILITY OF COMPONENTS AND COMPLETENESS OF HARDWARE. CONTACT ARCHITECT FOR CLARIFICATION.
- IN THE CASE OF DISCREPANCIES OR ERRORS, CONTACT ARCHITECT BEFORE ORDERING.
- AUTOMATIC FIRE/RATED SW'S MAY BE APPROVED UPON REQUESTS. CONTACT ARCHITECT FOR APPROVAL.
- PROVIDE SAMPLES OF HARDWARE COMPONENTS TO ARCHITECT FOR APPROVAL.
- PROVIDE 20 MIN. FIRE RATED/PAINT TREATED WOOD BLOCKING BEHIND ALL H.M. FRAMES, STUD SOIL WALLS WHERE MOUNTED TO STUDS (MINIMUM). PROVIDE AT ALL DOOR FRAMES AND HOSPITAL OPENINGS, PROVIDE 3" MIN. SOLID BLOCKING FOR DOOR CLOSER AND DOOR LOCK.
- PROVIDE COORDINATION FOR DOOR HARDWARE BY OTHERS - G.C. SHALL COORDINATE.
- PROVIDE DOOR STOPS AS REQUIRED.
- COORDINATE LOCATIONS OF DOORS, CONFERENCE BETWEEN OWNER, OWNER'S CONSULTANT, AND ARCHITECT. LOCATIONS OF ELECTRICAL SIGNAL BE COORDINATED WITH DOOR HARDWARE.
- SEE SHEET A8.01 FOR GUARD INFORMATION.

Summary : This architectural detail drawing illustrates the construction and installation of a stone threshold (TR7) at a door opening, showing the relationship between the door, floor finishes, and the stone threshold.

technical drawing:
# Threshold Details :
  • Title: "THRESHOLD DETAILS"
  • Detail reference: "TR7 - STONE THRESHOLD"
  • Scale: 3" = 1'-0"
  • Drawing shows a cross-sectional view at a door opening.

# Components & Labels :
  • Door frame, with annotation: "DOOR FRAME SCHEDULED, CENTER TRANSITION UNDER DOOR"
  • Floor finish on both sides of the threshold, labeled "FLOOR FINISH, AS SCHEDULED"
  • 1/2" thick stone threshold, labeled "1/2" THICK STONE THRESHOLD SET IN GROUTED ADHESIVE"
  • The stone threshold is set in adhesive and spans the width of the frame.
  • Dashed lines indicate the extent of the floor finish and the threshold.
  • Dimension line labeled "WIDTH OF FRAME" showing the threshold width matches the door frame.

# Annotations & Dimensions :
  • All key elements are labeled with leader lines.
  • The drawing is not to full scale but provides a scale reference for construction.
  • The threshold thickness is specified as 1/2".
  • The threshold is set in "GROUTED ADHESIVE".

# Analysis :
  • The detail ensures the stone threshold is centered under the door and matches the width of the frame.
  • Both adjacent floor finishes abut the threshold, providing a clean transition.
  • The use of grouted adhesive secures the stone threshold in place.
  • The drawing provides clear guidance for construction and installation of the threshold in architectural projects.

Summary : This is a construction detail section illustrating the interface between two porcelain tile floor areas, showing the use of a Schluter flooring transition strip and self-leveling compound.

section detail:
Components & Labels :
  • Porcelain tile is shown on both sides of the joint.
  • A Schluter flooring transition strip (color: satin anodized) is placed at the joint between the tiles.
  • Self-leveling compound is indicated beneath the tiles at the joint.

Spatial Relationships :
  • The transition strip is centered between the two porcelain tile sections.
  • The self-leveling compound is located directly below the transition strip and tiles, providing a level substrate.

Analysis :
  • The detail demonstrates a method for creating a smooth, durable transition between two tiled floor areas using a metal transition strip and self-leveling compound for substrate preparation.

6  TR6 - PORCELAIN TILE
    SCALE: 3" = 1'-0"

Summary : This is a construction detail section illustrating the interface between a door, floor tile, and carpet at a scheduled center transition under a door, including material callouts and finish notes.

section detail:
# Door and Floor Transition :
  • Door is shown in elevation, centered above a transition strip.
  • Floor tile is depicted on one side of the transition.
  • Carpet is depicted on the opposite side of the transition.
  • The transition occurs directly under the door.

# Material Callouts :
  • "DOOR WHERE SCHEDULED, CENTER TRANSITION UNDER DOOR"
  • "FLOOR TILE" on one side of the transition.
  • "SCHLUTER SCHIENE, OR SIMILAR, CLEAR ANODIZED ALUMINUM FINISH" at the transition strip.
  • "CARPET" on the opposite side of the transition.
  • "EXISTING SLAB w/ ARDEX OR SIMILAR" as the substrate below both finishes.

# Spatial Relationships :
  • The transition strip is aligned directly under the door leaf.
  • Floor tile and carpet meet at the transition strip, each on one side of the door.
  • All elements are shown in section (cut-through) view.

# Analysis :
  • The detail clarifies how to align and finish the transition between tile and carpet at a doorway, specifying the use of a metal transition strip for a clean, durable edge. The section ensures the transition is centered under the door for a neat appearance and functional separation of flooring types.

5  TR5 - TILE TO CARPET  
SCALE: 3" = 1'-0"

Summary : This is a technical section detail drawing showing the installation of an ADA-compliant flush threshold at a door, with references to floor tile, aluminum threshold, and matching door frame.

section detail:
Threshold & Floor Interface :
  • Floor tile labeled as "FLR TILE, EA-SIZE" on both sides of the threshold.
  • ADA-compliant flush threshold, specified as mill aluminum finish unless noted otherwise.
  • Threshold is centered and aligned with the door frame.
  • Note to "MATCH DOOR FRAME LWD" (likely referring to width).

Annotations & Materials :
  • Threshold material: mill aluminum finish.
  • No other materials or finishes specified unless otherwise noted.

Spatial Relationships :
  • The threshold sits flush with the floor tile on both sides.
  • The section is symmetrical about the threshold centerline.

Analysis :
  • The detail ensures accessibility compliance (ADA) by specifying a flush threshold.
  • The use of mill aluminum provides durability and a standard finish.
  • The drawing emphasizes alignment and matching with the door frame for a seamless transition.

Summary : This architectural section detail illustrates the transition between a tile floor and an exposed concrete slab or VCT (vinyl composition tile) at a door threshold, specifying the use of a Schluter pencil or similar aluminum trim.

section detail:
# Door Threshold Transition :
  • Shows a door installed above a floor transition.
  • Left side: floor tile.
  • Right side: exposed concrete slab or VCT, as indicated by the finish schedule.

# Components & Materials :
  • Door where scheduled; center transition under door.
  • Schluter pencil or similar, clear anodized aluminum finish, used as a trim at the edge of the tile.
  • Floor tile on one side of the threshold.
  • Exposed concrete slab or VCT on the other side.
  • Transition occurs directly under the door.

# Annotations & Labels :
  • "DOOR WHERE SCHEDULED; CENTER TRANSITION UNDER DOOR"

  • "FLOOR TILE"
  • "EXPOSED CONCRETE SLAB or VCT WHERE INDICATED ON FINISH SCHEDULE"

# Spatial Relationships :
  • The tile and concrete/VCT meet directly beneath the door.
  • The Schluter trim provides a clean edge between the two floor finishes.

# Analysis :
  • The detail ensures a neat, durable transition between different flooring materials at a doorway, with the transition concealed under the door for visual continuity and protection of tile edges.

Summary : This is a technical section detail drawing showing the installation of an ADA-compliant bumper threshold at a door frame, set between two exposed concrete slabs, with sealant applied on the door approach side.

technical section detail:
Threshold & Door Frame : 
  • ADA-compliant bumper threshold, finish: aluminum.
  • Threshold is centered under the width of the door frame.
  • Sealant is applied on the door approach (DA) side of the threshold.

Floor Slabs :
